jparsec.io.device

Class ObservationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • jparsec.io.device.ObservationManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class ObservationManager
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.ComponentListener
    A class to organize the observations in different folders, reduce them, and optionally execute observations in a completely automatic way.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ObservationManager.AVERAGE_METHOD
      The different possible methods to obtain the intensity in a given position in the output image given a set of intensities interpolated from the stacked images.
      static class  ObservationManager.AVERAGE_NORMALIZATION
      The different possible methods to obtain the intensity in a given position in the output image given a set of intensities interpolated from the stacked images.
      static class  ObservationManager.COMBINATION_METHOD
      Combination methods for individual flat/dark frames.
      static class  ObservationManager.DRIZZLE
      Drizzle modes for better output image quality.
      static class  ObservationManager.IMAGE_ORIENTATION
      The set of possible image orientations.
      static class  ObservationManager.INTERPOLATION
      The different possible interpolation methods to resample images during the stacking process.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObservationManager

        public ObservationManager(java.lang.String mainWorkingDir,
                  java.lang.String obsDir,
                  GenericTelescope.TELESCOPE_MODEL telescope,
                  GenericCamera.CAMERA_MODEL[] cameras,
                  GenericDome.DOME_MODEL dome,
                  GenericWeatherStation.WEATHER_STATION_MODEL weatherStation)
                   throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for an observation manager.
        Parameters:
        mainWorkingDir - Main working directory where all observations are located. Can be null, although in this case no reduction will be possible.
        obsDir - New observation directory for the current night, should be a (still) non-existing directory. You can use the date or a 'project name'. Can be null, although in this case no reduction will be possible.
        telescope - The telescope to use. In case of a real telescope port value will be initially null to select automatically the first available telescope. You can set later the port with setTelescopePort(String).
        cameras - The camera/s to use. Can be null, although in this case no reduction will be possible. In case of a real camera port will be initially null to select the first available one, you can later set the port with setCameraPort(int, String).
        dome - The dome model, or null.
        weatherStation - The weather station model, or null.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case any of the input values are incorrect.

    • Method Detail

      • setCombineMethod

        public void setCombineMethod(ObservationManager.COMBINATION_METHOD method)
        Sets the combination method for the individual dark/flat frames. The median method is better.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to use for combining.

      • getCombineMethod

        public ObservationManager.COMBINATION_METHOD getCombineMethod()
        Returns the combination method. Default value is null to force a selection the first time this value is required.
        Returns:
        The method to use for combining.

      • setInterpolationMethod

        public void setInterpolationMethod(ObservationManager.INTERPOLATION method)
        Sets the interpolation method to resample calibrated on images during the stacking process.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to use for interpolation.

      • getInterpolationMethod

        public ObservationManager.INTERPOLATION getInterpolationMethod()
        Returns the interpolation method. Default value is bicubic.
        Returns:
        The method to use for interpolation.

      • setAverageMethod

        public void setAverageMethod(ObservationManager.AVERAGE_METHOD method)
        Sets the stack method to obtain the final intensity in a given pixel of the output image given the intensities of their corresponding pixels in each of the stacked images.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to use for stacking frames.

      • getAverageMethod

        public ObservationManager.AVERAGE_METHOD getAverageMethod()
        Returns the stack method. Default value is ponseration for better quality.
        Returns:
        The method to use for stacking frames.

      • setNormalizationMethod

        public void setNormalizationMethod(ObservationManager.AVERAGE_NORMALIZATION method)
        Sets the normalization method to obtain the final averaged frame from stacked ones.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to use for normalization.

      • getNormalizationMethod

        public ObservationManager.AVERAGE_NORMALIZATION getNormalizationMethod()
        Returns the normalization method. Default value is minimum.
        Returns:
        The method to use for normalization.

      • setImageOrientation

        public void setImageOrientation(ObservationManager.IMAGE_ORIENTATION method)
        Sets the image orientation for the output processed frames.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to use for the image orientation.

      • getImageOrientation

        public ObservationManager.IMAGE_ORIENTATION getImageOrientation()
        Returns the image orientation. Default value is not inverted.
        Returns:
        The method to use for image orientation.

      • setDrizzleMethod

        public void setDrizzleMethod(ObservationManager.DRIZZLE method)
        Sets the drizzle method to apply to obtain the output image. Drizzling consists in oversampling the output image to try to get a better quality output.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to use for drizzle.

      • getDrizzleMethod

        public ObservationManager.DRIZZLE getDrizzleMethod()
        Returns the drizzle method. Default value is to not apply a drizzle operation.
        Returns:
        The method to use for drizzle.

      • setProjectInfo

        public void setProjectInfo(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String observer,
                  java.lang.String description)
        Sets additional information about the current project/observations. These values will be written to the header of each .fits file in case they are not null.
        Parameters:
        name - Project name, or null.
        observer - Observer's name, or null.
        description - Project description, or null.

      • getProjectInfo

        public java.lang.String[] getProjectInfo()
        Returns the values for the project properties.
        Returns:
        Project name, observer, and description. Default values are null for each of them.

      • setWeatherAlarmConditions

        public void setWeatherAlarmConditions(double humLim,
                             double windSpeedLim,
                             double tempMaxLim,
                             double tempMinLim)
        Sets the conditions for the weather alarm.
        Parameters:
        humLim - Maximum humidity outside or inside the observatory in %. Default is 80.
        windSpeedLim - Maximum speed limit in km/s. Default is 100.
        tempMaxLim - Maximum working temperature. Default is 50.
        tempMinLim - Minimum working temperature. Default is -20.

      • getWeatherAlarmConditions

        public double[] getWeatherAlarmConditions()
        Returns the weather alarm conditions.
        Returns:
        Four doubles with the maximum humidity in %, maximum wind speed in km/s, maximum temperature in C, and minimum working temperature in C.

      • setTelescopeType

        public void setTelescopeType(GenericTelescope.TELESCOPE_TYPE type)
        Sets the telescope type.
        Parameters:
        type - Telescope type.

      • getTelescopeType

        public GenericTelescope.TELESCOPE_TYPE getTelescopeType()
        Returns the telescope type.
        Returns:
        Telescope type.

      • setSExtractorValues

        public void setSExtractorValues(int minArea,
                       int sigma,
                       double minObjType,
                       int maxSources)
        Sets the values to configure how SExtractor will solve sources.
        Parameters:
        minArea - Minimum number of pixels for a detection.
        sigma - Minimum intensity ratio respect background for a detection in a pixel.
        minObjType - Objects are classified from star-like (0) to extended (1). Setting this to 0 will return all objects, setting it to 0.5 will return only star-like objects (classified from 0 to 0.5).
        maxSources - Maximum number of sources for the astrometric and photometric calibrations. Set to 0 to use all detected sources.

      • getSExtractorValues

        public double[] getSExtractorValues()
        Returns the configuration values for SExtractor: minimum number of pixels for detection, sigma, object classification limiting value, and maximum number of sources.
        Returns:
        The 4 values for SExtractor configuration. Values are in a double array despite only the object classification value is not an integer.

      • setTelescopePort

        public void setTelescopePort(java.lang.String port)
        Sets the telescope port.
        Parameters:
        port - Port value (COMx, /dev/tty...).

        public void setCameraPort(int index,
                 java.lang.String port)
        Sets the camera port.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the camera.
        port - Port value (usb: ... for DSLRs or /dev/videox for webcams).

      • getTelescopePort

        public java.lang.String getTelescopePort()
        Returns the telescope port.
        Returns:
        Telescope port (COMx, /dev/tty...). Null is returned if not set.

      • getCameraPort

        public java.lang.String getCameraPort(int index)
        Returns the camera port.
        Parameters:
        index - Index for the camera.
        Returns:
        The camera port (usb: ... for DSLRs or /dev/videox for webcams). Null is returned if not set.

      • setCameraDir

        public void setCameraDir(int index,
                java.lang.String dir)
        Sets the directory for the images taken from this camera. Should not be modified after observation begins.
        Parameters:
        index - Camera index.
        dir - Directory name. Default value is 'camerax', where x is 1+index.

      • setTelescopeParkPosition

        public void setTelescopeParkPosition(LocationElement loc)
        Sets the park position for the telescope.
        Parameters:
        loc - Park position in azimuth/elevation. Set to null for the default position of the telescope, in case it supports parking. Celestron does not support parking specifically, but a non-null location can be used to park it.

      • getTelescopeParkPosition

        public LocationElement getTelescopeParkPosition()
        Returns the park position for the telescope.
        Returns:
        Park position.

      • setCameraMinimumIntervalBetweenShots

        public void setCameraMinimumIntervalBetweenShots(int index,
                                        int seconds)
        Sets the minimum time between shots to allow the camera to cool down. Default is 0.
        Parameters:
        index - Index for the camera.
        seconds - Time in seconds.

      • getCameraMinimumIntervalBetweenShots

        public int getCameraMinimumIntervalBetweenShots(int index)
        Returns the time to wait to allow the camera to cool down. Default is 0.
        Parameters:
        index - Camera index.
        Returns:
        Time in seconds.

      • setCameraPositionError

        public void setCameraPositionError(int index,
                          double err)
        Sets the position error of the camera respect the telescope, in case the camera is piggy-backed and not perfectly aligned. Default is 0.
        Parameters:
        index - Index for the camera.
        err - Position error in radians.

      • getCameraPositionError

        Returns the position error of the camera respect the telescope, in case the camera is piggy-backed and not perfectly aligned. Default is 0.
        Parameters:
        index - Index for the camera.
        Returns:
        Position error in radians.

        public void setDarkDir(int index,
              java.lang.String dir)
        Sets the name of the directory where darks will be saved. Default value is 'dark'. Should not be modified after observation begins.
        Parameters:
        index - Index for the camera.
        dir - Directory name.

      • reductionEnabled

        public boolean reductionEnabled()
        Returns if reduction is enabled or not. By default it is enabled when working and observation directories are set correctly (which means that reduction is possible). Set to false to take shots without reducing them immediately.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • reductionPossible

        public boolean reductionPossible()
        Returns if reduction is possible or not. It is true when working and observation directories are set correctly.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • setReductionEnabled

        public void setReductionEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets if reduction should be enabled or not. This method will have no effect when reduction is not possible. In case of enabling reduction and taking, for instance, a dark frame, the superdark frame will be updated immediately, as well as all previous on shots. In the first dark/flat reduction the program will ask for the method to combine the frames.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True or false.

      • setAutoReduceOnFramesEnabled

        public void setAutoReduceOnFramesEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets if automatic reduction should be enabled or not for on frames. Default is true, and this means that in each new on frame the program will search for its corresponding master dark and flat, creating a reduced on frame in case the dark exists (using the flat if it exists, but flat is not required). No stacking or combination is done since this process should start at the end of the observations (automatically in case the reduction is enabled, or manually in case of further reducing a on frame located in the reduced directory). In the first reduction of an on frame the program will ask for the ratio of frames to be stacked and then combined.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True or false.

      • getAutoReduceOnFramesEnabled

        public boolean getAutoReduceOnFramesEnabled()
        Returns if on frames should be reduced automatically or not.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • offerFrame

        public void offerFrame(GenericCamera.IMAGE_ID id,
              java.lang.String path,
              ImageHeaderElement[] fitsHeader)
                throws JPARSECException
        Offers a new frame to this manager. In case of a PNG/JPG file the new file is copied to the corresponding folder as a fits, using the current system time (milliseconds from 1970) to set the name of the new file. In case of a raw file the file is previously converted to PGM using DCRaw, and then to fits.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier for the new frame: dark, flat, ... A 'test' frame is not processed.
        path - The path of the new file.
        fitsHeader - The fits header to be included in this image.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • offerFrame

        public void offerFrame(GenericCamera.IMAGE_ID id,
              java.lang.String[] path,
              ImageHeaderElement[] fitsHeader,
              int camIndex)
                throws JPARSECException
        Offers a new set of frames to this manager. In case of PNG/JPG files the new files are copied to the corresponding folder as fits, using the current system time (milliseconds from 1970) to set the names of the new files. In case of raw files the files are previously converted to PGM using DCRaw, and then to fits.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier for the new frame: dark, flat, ... A 'test' frame is not processed.
        path - The path of the new files. All must belong to the same directory and header, for instance to reduce a JPG+RAW observation.
        fitsHeader - The fits header to be included in these images.
        camIndex - The camera index identifying the camera that produces the images.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • executeDCRaw

        public static void executeDCRaw(java.lang.String file)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Process a given raw file using DCRaw. Parameters passed to DCRaw are fixed to obtain a PGM file as output. This method is called internally and you should have no need to call it manually.
        Parameters:
        file - Path to a raw file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • pgm

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage pgm(int maxcolval,
                               int[][] data,
                               boolean scale)
        Creates a gray image from the data contained in a integer array.
        Parameters:
        maxcolval - The maximum intensity in the input array, 255 for an 8 bit image, 65535 for a 16 bit image.
        data - The image data.
        scale - True to scale the data to 255 or 65535 in case the maximum intensity is not any of those 2 values. True is recommended unless the original count numbers should be preserved.
        Returns:
        The image.

      • getPixelCount

        public static int getPixelCount(int x,
                int y,
                java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        Returns the counts in a given pixel position for a gray image.
        Parameters:
        x - X position.
        y - Y position.
        img - The image.
        Returns:
        The count number.

      • readPGM

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage readPGM(java.lang.String file,
                                   boolean scale)
                                            throws JPARSECException
        Reads a PGM file from disk.
        Parameters:
        file - The path to the file.
        scale - True to scale values in the file to 255 (8 bit) or 65535 (16 bit). True is recommended unless the original count numbers should be preserved.
        Returns:
        The image.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • writePGM

        public static void writePGM(java.lang.String file,
            int[][] img,
            int max)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Writes a PGM file to disk, as a P5 file.
        Parameters:
        file - The path to the file.
        img - The image to write, with the counts at pixel [x][y].
        max - The maximum number of counts allowed in the image.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
